result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dionte Mortez Roberts

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dionte Mortez Roberts in court.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan in court for Dionte Mortez Roberts.  Prosecuting Attorney Thomas Hasle and Careen Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Court enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 101626,
Payable Number: 1041032,
Receipt Number: 22RP042864,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Dionte Mortez Roberts appeared by video.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan appeared by video for Dionte Mortez Roberts.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Hearing held, defense needs additional time to pay retainer fee for Attorney Nolan. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dionte Mortez Roberts appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.
Indigency hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cash bond previously posted remains. 
The Court ordered No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dionte Mortez Roberts in court. Attorney Amanda Poznanski with defendant Dionte Mortez Roberts. Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Court enters Not Guilty plea as to Count 2.  Defendant does not qualify for SPD representation. Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing, Branch PE.
Adjourned plea hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/19/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on September 19, 2022 at 1:00 PM
